events.name: Dissertation Fair
events.description:
Calling all 3rd years!

With the dissertation choice deadline getting closer, Iâ€™m sure many of you feel that you need more information to be able to pick the best choice.

We will be holding a STUDENT-LED dissertation fair, where you will be able to ask questions to past psych student volunteers about their experiences working on diss!

This will be your chance to hear authentic opinions about projects, supervisors, and overall workload.

Our volunteers covered a wide range of topics within different fields of psychology, including:

- The role of disgust in deterring dairy consumption

- Exploring Verbal Cues used by Autistic Individuals with Anorexia during Social Interactions

- The Effects of Social Identity Processes on Perceived Risk at Pilot Sporting Events Held During COVID-19

And many more TBA :)

No sign-ups are required! Just turn up on the day or join the Teams meeting on the link in our bio.

events.name: 13th Psychology Days
events.description:
Hello everyone! We are here with the 13th Psychology Days organized by Istanbul University Psychology Club, with the theme 'Mysticism'. âœ¨

As humans questioning existence, they have begun to ask more questions about who they are in the face of a changing world. They delved into the depths of consciousness and embarked on mystical paths. At times, they felt inner peace, at times turmoil. The answers they found raised new questions. Some resorted to facts, while others used traditional methods. Our speakers, who will guide us like a compass on this journey, will shed light on questions related to mysticism through modern psychology.

Our event will take place on May 4-5, 2024, at the Ord. Prof. Dr. Cemil Bilsel Conference Hall. ğŸ¤

â—Our event is free and open to everyone.

â—The doors will open at 09:15 for our event.

events.name: IX. National Psychology Days: Hope
events.description:
Hello Everyone!

We are pleased to announce the theme for this yearâ€™s IX. National Psychology Days: HOPE!

After much deliberation, we have found it fitting for our esteemed event to center around the theme of Hope.

Throughout the past year, we turned inward, tired, broke, and even got angry, but most of all, we felt hopeless. Now, with the arrival of spring, we have decided to nurture the seeds of hope within us. You are all invited to our event, where the theme of Hope will be approached from various perspectives.

events.name: 35 Basic Techniques Used in Psychotherapy
events.description:
Within the scope of the program, regardless of the school they practice, participants will be provided with 35 fundamental techniques from various approaches, essential for their toolkit. These techniques are designed to facilitate swift change in clients, especially when encountering challenges during psychotherapy sessions.

The objective of the program is to impart practical skills in applying a wide array of fundamental techniques functional in therapy and derived from many different schools. Throughout the program, participants will be introduced to the theoretical underpinnings of effective and functional techniques from evidence-based therapeutic schools.

Following this theoretical presentation, participants will be given detailed instructions on how to apply these techniques through case studies, and will have the opportunity to practice these techniques through role-plays. This approach ensures that participants complete the program with both a theoretical understanding and practical experience in applying these key techniques.

events.name: Advanced Counseling Skills
events.description:
We are excited to introduce a brand new program to you! ğŸ¤—

'Advanced Counseling Skills' is a highly transformative program that we have been eager to share with you for many years. We believe it is extremely impactful for therapy rooms and therapist-client relationships, and it will elevate counseling skills to the next level.

Covering a wide range of topics from effective communication skills, a fundamental principle of psychotherapy, to the dynamics of therapy processes, the program will be led by Expert Clinical Psychologist AyÅŸegÃ¼l Kalem, who has made significant contributions to this field for years, and presented by the world-renowned psychologist Prof. Jeffrey A. Kottler, with guidance from the experts at Psychology Istanbul and YENÄ° Psychology. Throughout the training, you will enhance your advanced counseling skills through a comprehensive manual, practical exercises, case examples, and interactive learning.

events.name: Schema Therapy Practitioner Training
events.description:
ğŸ—“ï¸ June 1-2-22-23, 2024
ğŸ”¸ 32 Hours Online Training
ğŸ”¸ 8 Hours Online Supervision
ğŸ”¸ Opportunity to Review Lessons
ğŸ”¸ University-approved certificate visible on E-Government
ğŸ”¸ Free Materials
ğŸ”¸ Limited Capacity, High-Yield Training

âœ… Schema therapy, developed by Young and colleagues, is an integrative and relatively newer type of therapy that combines elements of cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT), psychoanalysis, attachment theory, and emotion-focused therapy. It aims to treat personality disorders and other psychiatric disorders that do not respond to other treatment options. As it is known, resolving characterological problems with classical cognitive-behavioral therapy is quite challenging. In Schema Therapy, the goal is to identify early maladaptive schemas stemming from unmet basic needs in early childhood and raise awareness in the patient about them. Treatment approaches in Schema Therapy often progress not through schemas themselves but through the 'mode concept,' which involves the combination of activated schemas and coping styles.
